entry.title: Re: Why SAP ISA-M Still Matters ‚Äì A Strategic Foundation for Modern Integration
entry.content:
Ok, thanks. Meanwhile I have few comments.

1. Implementation and Real-Life Use

  • Can you share real-world examples where ISA-M guided a successful implementation using SAP Integration Suite?

  • How have other companies used ISA-M to prioritize interfaces for modernization, especially under resource constraints?

  • What‚Äôs the most efficient way to categorize 100+ existing interfaces using ISA-M's use case classification?

2. Integration Strategy and Governance

  • What governance model do you recommend for a hybrid setup involving CPI, non-SAP APIs, and legacy systems?

  • How can we leverage ISA-M to enforce design standards (e.g., event vs. traditioal methods) across multiple teams and vendors?

  • Do you have templates for an Integration Control Board (ICB) or similar decision-making body based on ISA-M?

3. Tooling and Automation

  • How can tools like LeanIX, Signavio, and SAP Integration Suite be integrated practically under the ISA-M framework?

  • Does SAP provide any accelerators or templates to load existing interface data into LeanIX or Signavio for assessment?

  • Can ISA-M be automated using SAP Cloud ALM to track integration health and roadmap progress?

4. Clean Core and Event-Driven Architecture

  • How can ISA-M guide the transition to SAP Advanced Event Mesh in a Clean Core context?

  • What criteria from ISA-M help decide whether to expose something as an API vs. an event or IDoc?

5. Community Best Practices and Change Management

  • What are some common pitfalls teams face when applying ISA-M in complex organizations with multiple LoBs?

  • Are there any customer success stories or communities where ISA-M knowledge is being actively shared?

entry.title: Re: Error en nota de Criterio al articulo 29 de la Ley de...
entry.content:
Hola a todos,

siguiendo las recomendaciones de Hugo, para que PRDNT no tome valores en retro y muestre el error en la regla X030 , se puede hacer lo siguiente:

Crear una constante en V_T511K, en mi caso el periodo actual es 27.07.2025, es decir el cambio es v√°lido con un 1 en esa constante.

luego crear una reglita para tomar el valor de la constante, regresando  un False si la fecha es menor o un True si es mayor o igual a la fecha del periodo actual

por ultimo modificar el esquema para que solo el cambio sea v√°lido en True y False tenga el comportamiento anterior

 

Entonces en periodos retro va a tomar la funcionalidad anterior:

y a partir del periodo acutal, tomar√° lo descrito en la nota

Espero que les sea √∫til

saludos!

Johnatan

entry.title: SAP Databricks: Building an Intelligent Enterprise with AI Unleashed ‚Äì Part 1
entry.content:
Part 1 ‚Äì SQL analytics with SAP Data Products
Part 2 ‚Äì Build and deploy Mosaic AI and Agent Tools
Part 3 ‚Äì Connect SAP Data Products with non-SAP data from AWS S3
Part 4 ‚Äì End-to-end integration: SAP Databricks, SAP Datasphere, and SAP Analytics Cloud
Part 5 ‚Äì Create inferences and endpoints for application integration with SAP Build

SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud 

SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) enables seamless, governed, and semantically rich access to business data, unlocking its full potential through AI-driven analytics and intelligent applications.

The SAP blog by Mona has covered foundational capabilities and the value proposition of SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud. Building on those insights, this multi-blog series will deep-dive into pro-code AI/ML capabilities, real-world analytics with SAP Data Products, and ecosystem integration.

In this post, we focus on SQL analytics in SAP Databricks, demonstrating the seamless scalability on SAP Data Products exposed through SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC). With SAP BDC, these data products come pre-enriched with business context, making them immediately usable for high-impact analytics and AI.

Setting up SAP Databricks

To prepare for working with data products in SAP Databricks, a user with an administrator role must:

  • Add the SAP Databricks tenant to the formation (see Creating SAP Business Data Cloud Formations).
  • Activate one or more data packages (see Activate Data Packages).
  • Provide access to the SAP Databricks tenant (see Manage Users and Roles).

To make data products available for consumption in SAP Databricks, follow the step-by-step guide from the SAP Help Portal. Once connected, SAP Data Products will appear in SAP Databricks Unity Catalog, shared from SAP BDC Catalog‚Äîremoving the need for duplication or external ETL tools.

An additional guide includes the Databricks Documentation, outlining the responsibilities of admins, data sharing configurations, and API references.

SQL Analytics with SAP Data Products

SAP Databricks SQL offers a unified development environment for querying SAP Data Products. Whether you're analyzing financial transactions or supplier records, you can run powerful, AI-augmented SQL directly on trusted SAP data without replication.


Forecasting with SAP Databricks AI Functions ‚Äì ai_forecast()

SAP Databricks provides built-in task-specific functions to automate common analytics workflows. One such function is ai_forecast(), which enables automated time series forecasting on SAP Data Products‚Äîwithout requiring custom ML code.

Behind the scenes, SAP Databricks selects the optimal time series model‚Äîsuch as ARIMA, ETS, Prophet, and XGBoost. This allows business users to perform forecasting at scale with just SQL. For full model control and customization, SAP Databricks Python notebooks and MLFlow can be used to define, train, and deploy specific time series models.

The following workflow uses the Customer Data Product to forecast daily new customer counts:

  • Aggregate new customers per day
  • Set a forecasting horizon (e.g., 30 days after 2025-07-28)
  • Run ai_forecast() to generate daily projections along with upper/lower confidence intervals

Summarizing Daily Net Cash Movement with SAP Databricks Assistant

Harnessing the power of SAP Databricks Assistant, SQL queries can be effortlessly crafted using natural language prompts. For instance, leveraging the Cash Flow Data Product, you can track daily net cash movement by company code with the following prompt:

‚ÄúSummarize daily net cash flow by company code from the table cash_flow_dp.cashflow.cashflow:
- Convert PostingDate to date format as posting_date
- Filter out rows with null PostingDate, AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency, or CompanyCode
- Group by posting_date and CompanyCode
- Aggregate the sum of AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency as net_cash_flow
- Order results by posting_date‚Äù

Finance teams can identify cash positions, monitor liquidity in near real-time, and optimize working capital with predictive analytics in SAP Databricks.

SAP Databricks SQL Notebook to supercharge SQL Analytics

Quality Checks on Supplier Data Product

Using Databricks SQL Notebook and Gen AI, you can perform intelligent, real-time data quality assessments on the Supplier Data Product. This approach allows you to proactively identify missing or inconsistent data‚Äîsuch as VAT numbers, country codes, or postal codes‚Äîwithout building complex pipelines.

  1. Identify missing VAT, country, or postal code
  2. Summarize the issue
  3. Ask the LLM for diagnosis and recommendations
  4. Store the result in a new summary table

This supports governed, AI-powered data collaboration across teams ‚Äì all without moving or duplicating data outside the SAP Business Data Cloud landscape.

In Part 1, we explored how to:

  • Seamlessly access and explore SAP Data Products within SAP Databricks
  • Perform enterprise-grade SQL analytics on financial and supplier data
  • Enhance insights using AI-powered functions like ai_forecast() and ai_query() for forecasting and intelligent querying

In Part 2, we‚Äôll explore how to build and deploy Mosaic AI and Agent Tools within SAP Databricks‚Äîenabling intelligent automation, real-time decisioning, and embedded AI experiences.

entry.title: Prevent empty version columns in table for version‚Äêrestricted measure
entry.content:
I have a story based on an Account-based model that uses multiple versions (A0, A1, A2, B0, B1, C0, D0, E10, E20, E30). In the underlying model, I‚Äôve created calculated measures that are restricted to specific versions‚Äîfor example, a measure that only applies to version D0.

Problem:
Even though the measure is correctly defined to return values only for version D0, when I add it to a table in my story, SAC still creates separate columns for every version (A0‚ÄìE30), leaving most columns empty. This results in a large number of unnecessary blank columns.

Question:
Is there a way to prevent SAC from generating empty columns for versions where the restricted measure has no data? In other words, can I force the table to show the measure only under its defined version (D0) and omit all other version columns entirely?

entry.title: Where to control when the accrual calendar runs? Accrual Creation Offset [Days] usage
entry.content:
Dear SAP community, 

We would like to change when the accrual happens in our time account. Instead of having it running on the first day of the validity period, we need it to happen later due to our requirements. 

The guide says we should use the field "Accrual Creation Offset [Days]". The help text says "You must enter a number in this field if you are using it in the rule" and the guide says "You must make an entry in this field if you‚Äôre using it in the rule."

Which rule - from all the rules that we have in the time account type object - is controlling this? 

For example, I'd like the accrual to happen six months after the validity of my annual account. How would you configure this?

Thank you

Laura

Best regards Dominik

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud - Performance Recommendations for Story Designers
entry.content:
Starting with 2025.Q3 QRC Release and Wave 2025.13 we release Performance Recommendations in the Info Panel of the Story Design Time in SAP Analytics Cloud

How can story developers ensure that their content not only captivates visually but also performs optimally? In our latest update, available in Wave 13 2025 or with the Q3 QRC, we reveal how the info panel now provides crucial insights into the widgets that influence content performance during the design phase. This enhancement builds upon our existing widget in-app analysis, allowing you to proactively identify areas for improvement and close performance gaps, helping your stories to be both engaging and effective.

Evolution of the in-app widget analysis

The in-app widget analysis was the first step in the journey of our guided design approach. Previously, developers had to individually check each widget to determine whether performance recommendations were available. This could be a time-consuming process, especially depending on the complexity of the story. To streamline this experience, we now present this information consolidated for the entire page. This enhancement allows developers to quickly assess performance issues and focus their efforts on optimizing content more efficiently.

Guide to Using the Info Panel for Performance Recommendations

Step 1: Open the Info Panel

After opening your Story in edit mode, click the ‚ÄúInfo Panel‚Äù icon in the upper right corner of the user interface. You can recognize it by the red dot, indicating that recommendations are available.

Step 2: Overview of Performance Recommendations

In the Info Panel, you'll find various tabs. Select the ‚ÄúPerformance Recommendations‚Äù tab to get an overview of the performance data and recommendations for the widgets in your story.

 

Step 3: View Detailed Recommendations

Under the ‚ÄúPerformance Recommendations‚Äù tab, you will see a list of widgets that have performance issues. Each widget shows specific warnings marked with a red or yellow dot:

  • Red Dot: Indicates serious performance issues that should be addressed immediately. For example: ‚ÄúThe initial drill level... is large. Decrease the drill level.‚Äù
  • Yellow Dot: Indicates potential issues that should be noted. For example: ‚ÄúThe member 'Calculated Revenue' has 3 exception aggregation dimensions... Reduce the number of dimensions...‚Äù

 

Step 4: Take Action

Use the provided recommendations to take steps to optimize the performance issues. You can adjust drill levels, reduce the number of dimensions, or make other suggested changes. Be sure to check the performance again afterward.

Step 5: Continuous Performance Monitoring

Regularly check the ‚ÄúPerformance Recommendations‚Äù tab to ensure your adjustments achieve the desired results. Use the Info Panel as an ongoing tool for optimizing your widgets and stories.

Summary

With the introduction of the new info panel for in-app widget analysis, we aim to foster a proactive approach to content design. Our goal is for designers to create high-performing content from the beginning, minimizing the risk of encountering performance issues that could have been identified and addressed during the design phase. The consolidated view of performance indicators and recommendations in the info panel empowers developers to make informed decisions and optimize their stories effectively. This not only enhances the efficiency of the development process but also improves the overall quality of the content produced.

Looking Ahead

As we continue to enhance the Info Panel, we want to keep you informed about our commitment to improving the performance notifications. Our team is actively working on refining the alerts and providing additional context to make the insights more actionable and valuable for your work.

In the coming releases, you can expect to see enriched information integrated into the performance recommendations. These updates will aim to provide clearer guidance and more specific actions to optimize your widgets effectively.

We encourage you to stay tuned and keep an eye on the updates in the Info Panel. Engaging with these enhancements will ensure that you are making the most of the tools available to you.

Thank you for being a part of this journey, and we look forward to supporting you with these improvements!

I have this code:

    IF l_count_1 > 0.

      DATA: ls_layout TYPE lvc_s_layo.
      ls_layout-box_fname = 'CHECKBOX'.

      CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY_LVC'

          it_fieldcat_lvc           = gt_fcat

          i_callback_pf_status_set  = 'SET_PF_STATUS'

          t_outtab                  = it_finalize_lines
        EXCEPTIONS
          program_error             = 1
          OTHERS                    = 2.

        EXPORTING
          titel = 'Finalize'
          txt1  = 'No Countts to Finalize.'
          txt2  = ''.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

All I want is two buttons Finalize and Exit

Any idea?
Best Regards
Thanks in advance

entry.title: Unallocated value displayed in migrated S/4 data does not match pre-migration data ‚Äì Material Ledger
entry.content:
We are currently undergoing a Brownfield migration to S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023 [02 (10/2024)].

After the migration of our quality environment, completed in June 2025, we identified that all materials consumed at standard cost and generating price differences started to show unassigned values in the periods related to the migrated data. In the production environment, these price differences for the same periods were correctly rolled up to the next level. These unassigned values do not match the expected behavior for our current scenario.

The analyses were carried out using transaction CKM3, and the unassigned values shown are significantly high, distorting reports and directly impacting the managerial view that will be used by the business.

Based on SAP Notes related to Material Ledger in S/4HANA, we understand that there is no longer a distinction between single-level and multilevel price differences. However, we believe the migrated data should faithfully reflect what was previously processed in the productive system ‚Äî that is, the same total values across the relevant categories (opening/closing inventory, receipts, consumption).

When accessing CKM3 for periods that include migrated data, the reports display abnormal and inflated values, leading to an internal question:
Shouldn‚Äôt this data be viewed using transaction CKM3OLD instead?

However, upon reviewing SAP Note 2426371, we found the following guidance:

"For the unmigrated data, you need to use the transaction CKM3OLD. The unmigrated data are the data that are older than last period of year before previous year. For migrated data, in CKM3 or CKM3N you can show only the summarization data and without the individual posting lines and without material ledger settlement line. To show the whole posting, you need to use the transaction CKM3OLD. You may need to use both of the transaction CKM3 and CKM3OLD if you have mixed data in the same period created before and after the upgrade to S/HANA."

In other words, since the migration took place in June 2025, data from December 2023 onwards is considered migrated and should be analyzed using CKM3/CKM3N, even if in summarized form.
Data prior to December 2023 should be analyzed via CKM3OLD.

However, the main issue is not the summarization of the data, but rather the fact that the values presented in the migrated data do not reflect the same reality seen in the productive environment prior to the migration, especially in detail.

We also have custom developments (Z programs) that call standard CKM3 functions in mass processing, and they are also heavily impacted ‚Äî returning the same distorted view regarding the unassigned amounts.

I am attaching visual evidence that clearly demonstrates the discrepancies we have observed.

We need to understand whether this is an expected behavior after migration (something we have to live with), or if it may indicate an issue in the migration steps ‚Äî so we can raise this clearly with our business partner and properly explain the reason behind the current results.

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: Bottle Condition Type for PO - SAP
entry.content:
You‚Äôve set Condition Category = F (Delivery Costs). This means SAP expects the cost to be settled via planned delivery cost logic, not as a PO item price.

In MIRO, delivery costs are only included if

  • the condition is flagged as planned delivery cost,
  • the delivery cost indicator is set in the PO item,
  • the GR-based IV flag is correctly set.

Try changing the Condition Category from F to blank or G if you want it treated as a regular surcharge. Also, you have marked ZBEP as an item condition, which is good. But if it‚Äôs not linked to a specific item or if the item is flagged incorrectly, MIRO may ignore it. Confirm that the condition is applied to a valid item and not just header-level.

Coming to output, if you are using SAPscript, SmartForms, or Adobe Forms, the form must be configured to read and display condition types. For information, only price conditions are printed by default. So enhance the form logic to include ZBEP. Discuss with your Technical team. The logic can be modify the form to loop through all condition types, add a filter to include ZBEP specifically and format the output to show it as a separate line item or note

Finally, try simulating the invoice in MIRO and click Environment > Messages to see if SAP is silently skipping ZBEP due to config or tolerance limits.

entry.title: Re: S4 Public cloud - schedule billing creation
entry.content: I forget to mention that in apps like Create Billing Documents or Schedule Billing Jobs, the billing date selection often uses relative dates, but it doesn‚Äôt inherently block future dates unless explicitly coded. You can enhance the selection variant with a custom ABAP routine or BAdI SD_BIL_CREATE

entry.title: Re: Sale Order EventMesh
entry.content:
Hi,

Based on the information available, there are several potential causes for why your Sales Order event is not being triggered despite successful API data retrieval:

Event Triggering Mechanisms: The system uses notification messages that are triggered at field level when sales orders are created, changed, or deleted through various channels including apps, services, or follow-on processes [1].

Potential Causes for Missing Events:

  1. Outbound Service Configuration: The system needs to be properly configured so that outbound services are triggered when inbound requests are processed. Without proper setup, events may not fire even when sales orders are successfully created [1].

  2. API Type Mismatch: Different APIs serve different purposes:

    • Sales Order - Send Processing Notification (A2A) sends detailed field-level information for individual sales orders
    • Sales Order - Confirm Processing (A2A) sends confirmation messages
    • Standard retrieval APIs may not automatically trigger notification events [1]

  3. Message Processing Flow: The notification system is designed to send one message per successfully processed sales order with detailed information. If your Sales Order Type (CCPU) isn't properly configured in the notification setup, events may not be generated [1].

[1] FAQ for Sales Order Management and Processing

Best regards, Dequan Xu

entry.title: Being an SAP Champion: A Journey of Growth and Connection
entry.content:
Becoming an SAP Champion has been one of the most rewarding experiences of my professional journey. Not only because it represents recognition for the work I‚Äôve been doing, but especially because it has connected me even more deeply with a community that transforms, inspires, and empowers.

To me, the SAP community has always been a space of continuous learning. It‚Äôs where professionals from different fields and experience levels come together to exchange ideas, share solutions, and, above all, build together. Actively participating in this network has been essential for both my technical and personal development.

 SAP Inside Track S√£o Paulo - 2025

The knowledge shared through forums, webinars, study groups, and events like SAP Inside Track is truly transformative. It‚Äôs in these gatherings that we witness, in practice, the power of networking and collaboration. Every story shared, every challenge overcome together reinforces how much stronger we are when we walk side by side.

Becoming a Champion has brought me even greater visibility and responsibility. It‚Äôs inspiring to contribute to the growth of others, support those who are just starting, encourage the exchange of experiences, and promote initiatives that strengthen the community. At the same time, I‚Äôm constantly inspired by the talent, generosity, and passion of the professionals who make up this ecosystem.

I believe the strength of the SAP community goes far beyond technology. It lies in the connection between people. In the genuine desire to grow and make a difference. In mutual support. And in every small act of collaboration that turns into meaningful personal, professional, and even social progress.

If today I feel more prepared, more connected, and more fulfilled, I owe a great deal to this journey within the community. And I continue with enthusiasm, contributing, learning, and giving back everything it has given me.

SAP Inside Track Fortaleza organizing team and family attending SITSP

entry.title: Re: advanced ATP for third party sales orders
entry.content:
If your material is already flagged as a third-party item (e.g. item category TAN with third-party processing), it may not be treated as a candidate for substitution. ABC is designed to substitute ATP-relevant materials, typically NORM-type materials, with third-party sourcing options. The substitution logic assumes the original item is a stock item that can be replaced with a third-party sourced variant.
If you ask why item category be TAN instead of TAS is because, TAN representing a stocked product. When aATP identifies a substitute that is sourced externally, it creates a CB1/CBAB subitem, which is processed as a third-party item, but only after substitution. So what you can do is test a material with NORM and see how it works

entry.title: Emarsys promotion in fail safe mode - alert notification
entry.content:
Hi,  

We have had a promotion automation which was put into 'failsafe mode'.  We can see in the notification centre that we can set up notifications for this scenario, however, we need to send an email to a specific end point to connect to our pager duty out of hours support tool.  This would be a global setting for any campaign or promotion automation that goes into failsafe mode - so that we can alert IT to investigate and initiate discussions with SAP.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Emarsys promotion in fail safe mode - alert notification
entry.content:
Hello,

 

In order to receive failsafe notifications via email, you can toggle the option "Also in email" at the notification center. You can enable this option for all notifications or only for the automation programs, if you prefer so.

You can check how to perform this change in details at SAP Emarsys Help: The Notification Center. This email message will be sent to the same contacts that receive the notification inside Emarsys itself.

 

Best regards,

SAP Technical Support

entry.title: Conflict Between Employee Master cost center Defaults and Work Center in CATS Cost Posting
entry.content:
Hi Experts, 

We are using the CATS timesheet to book time against project network activities.
We have configured the default master cost center using the Organizational Assignment Infotype (0001) in the CATS Data Entry Profile, and maintained the pricing in KP26 for the relevant activity type.
(Reference: SAP Note 333884 ‚Äì "Which default values are used when?")
However, during time booking via CAT2 for network activities, the system checks for a Work Center. To avoid dependency on operational Work Centers, we created a dummy Work Center without assigning a cost center or activity type.
Issue
When this setup is used, no actual cost is posted to the project, even though pricing is available for the employee‚Äôs cost center and activity type via IT0001 and KP26.
To test further, we assigned minimal pricing by maintaining a dummy cost center and activity type in the Work Center. This allowed actual cost posting ‚Äî and the system still picked the pricing from the Infotype 0001 cost center and activity type.
This leads to confusion:
‚Ä¢ Why is maintaining cost center and activity type in the Work Center mandatory if the actual pricing is still derived from the employee master data?
‚Ä¢ Is this the standard system behavior in S/4HANA?
Concern:
Maintaining pricing data (KP26) for dummy Work Centers introduces additional effort and unnecessary maintenance


Regards,

SarfaraZ

PLM Project System (PS) SAP Timesheet

entry.title: Re: Check Manager Settings in CCM
entry.content:
Hi @SatwikJoshi99, 

Here is the explanation provided by SAP for Check Manager: 

Additional Checks for Settlement Run

The system performs several standard checks and checks based on configuration settings whether a settlement can be performed for a condition contract, for the specified settlement date, and the settlement type.

Examples for simple checks are that a condition contract must have status Released, it may not have a settlement lock and the condition contract has yet not been settled for a specific settlement date.

An example for a configuration setting is parameter Requirement Next Settlement Allowed of the condition contract type that controls which status the settlement documents for previous settlement dates need to have, so that the settlement run for the next settlement date can be performed.
With the Check Manager tool you can configure additional checks whether a settlement run is allowed.

Prerequisite

You have to create global ABAP classes in the class pool which implement the additional checks.
To specify additional checks in the Check Manager tool, choose Customizing activity Checks for Settlement Run in the Check Manager .

To resume is for additional and custom check at the settlement document creation, change or release to accounting you would like to implement.
For example: check the amount of accrual match or => rebates/commissions/royalties, if not throw an error message
Check the profit center is determined, if not throw an error message...

Application Status (check manager) SAP definition, quite explicit: 

Check Manager: Skip Checks

The Setting controls if checks have to be performed for documents with this specific application status or settlement block.

Use

Check Manager

Example

Manually blocked documents should not be checked, because this happens on release and will possibly cause a status change to an error status.

Application log (check manager) SAP definition, quite explicit: 

Check Manager: Keep Application Logs

If this flag is set, all application logs remain in the system until archived.
Otherwise only the last protocol for each document application log object/subobject is kept.

Regards, 
Gauthier Victor

entry.title: Access to Historical Production Orders incl. BOMs after S4 Cloud Migration ‚Äì Feasible Approach?
entry.content:
Hi all,

We're currently preparing a system transition to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud for a midsize manufacturing company. One key requirement raised by the Sales Back Office is:

‚ÄúHistorical production orders (including materials, BOMs, and production data) must remain fully traceable ‚Äì especially to track past configurations and spare parts.‚Äù

We are not planning a full migration of legacy production data, but we still need a reliable, user-friendly way to access historical information from the new system.

Key questions to the community:

  1. What are your proven approaches to ensure traceability of historical production orders ‚Äì even without full migration?
    Any experience with read-only data access through SAP BTP, standalone HANA DB or custom UIs?

  2. Have you implemented deep-linking or referencing between current S/4HANA Public Cloud transactions and archived legacy data (SAP ECC or non-SAP)?
    How does it work in practice ‚Äì especially in terms of authorization, UX and responsiveness?

  3. Has anyone successfully enabled BOM traceability and structure navigation from current orders or service cases back into historical orders?
    If so, would you be willing to share key design considerations or technical architecture?

Context:

  • Target system: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

  • Source system: SAP ECC 6.0

  • Legacy data: Should remain accessible but not fully migrated

Any insights, architecture sketches or war stories are highly appreciated!

Best regards
Christian

entry.title: Re: can we maintain the budget restriction using WBS elem...
entry.content:
Hi Ken,

Thanks for your response! 

Yes, I agree with you that the commitment for a PR will consume budget as long as the PR is account assigned to the WBS element. But in case of plant maintenance, we select WBS element and cost centre in Plant maintenance order. The Budget check should happen at the maintenance order level or the PR level( What usually happens in other case with account assignment as 'P' which is Project where we can assign a WBS element). Where as in the case where a PR is generated w.r.t a plant maintenance order, the account assignment type is 'F' which is order. And in this the WBS element is not there under account assignment so the system is unable to check the budget at PR level. 

The business requirement is that they need budget check for plant maintenance orders while they create a Plant maintenance order or it will suffice the requirement on PR level as well. Please suggest how this requirement can be fulfilled.

Regards,

Arun

entry.title: Interface Execution Summary/Exception Alert for Logging/Monitoring and Debugging
entry.content:
Use case - As part of debugging/monitoring, commonly used approach is sending mail alert in exception sub process to the application maintenance team (here in refer as AM Team). Also, sending a success execution summary mail with relevant interface details is send across to AM team or user depending on business requirement.

Challenge - Tracer logs data for 10mins and at near real-time. In cases where AM team needs more data for debugging post runtime execution, info level data in the monitoring log is not adequate for debugging. In complex interfaces with modular flows and process directs, tracing the flow execution gets consuming.

Approach - Keeping above points in thought, below is solution which I have applied in my design which is reusable. It is combination of below -

  • groovy script
  • custom header
  • content modifier

Implementation - 

1. Content Modifier - Set a variable with a custom text message according to your iflow logic. Key is to - set a logical text message which assist the Developer or AM Team to understand - which logic checkpoint is cleared or failed and why. This text message will appear in custom header and also in mail. One can set Content Modifier in Router branches, LIP, Exception subprocess, Multicast branches, before/after request reply call etc. as seem suited.

I am using variable - 'FlowExecutionStatusMsg' in Content modifier and Groovy script 

2. Below is the reusable Groovy Script which you can place in script collection or use locally in iflow. This needs to be placed in Exception Subprocess for Mail Alert and also at end of iflow for Interface Execution Summary Mail (optional). It captures the camel exception and runtime properties, headers and payload along with the custom text message set in the flow at the runtime.

/* Title - GS_InterfaceExecutionSummary.groovyscript.                  Objective - Groovy Script For Interface Execution Summary Mail ; captures runtime error, headers, properties and payload.
*/

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
//import groovy.json.JsonOutput
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat

Message processData(Message message) {
   
    def messageLog = messageLogFactory.getMessageLog(message)
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ//get message components
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇdef body = message.getBody(String)
    def headers = message.getHeaders()
    def properties = message.getProperties()
   
    // Sort headers and properties alphabetically
    def sortedHeaders = headers.sort { it.key }
    def sortedProperties = properties.sort { it.key }

    // Get timestamp in system timezone (runtime)
    def sdf = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss z")
    def currentTimestamp = sdf.format(new Date())
   
    //for attachment file
    def label = "FlowLog_" + currentTimestamp.replace(" ", "_").replace(":", "-")
   
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ// get custom logger details from flow
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇdef FlowExecutionStatusMsg = properties.get("FlowExecutionStatusMsg") ?: "Not Set"
    def Iflow_Name = properties.get("Iflow_Name") ?: "Not Set"
    def MPL_id = properties.get("SAP_MessageProcessingLogID") ?: "Not Set"

    // Exception
    def exceptionRaw = properties.get("CamelExceptionCaught")
    def exceptionDetails = ""
    if (exceptionRaw)
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ{
        def exMsg = exceptionRaw.getMessage() ?: exceptionRaw.toString()
        def exType = exceptionRaw.getClass().getSimpleName()
        exceptionDetails = """

Exception Type: ${exType}
Message       : ${exMsg}

Stack Trace:
${exceptionRaw.toString()}
"""
    } else {
        exceptionDetails = "--- NO Exception Captured ---"
    }

    // Start of Build HTML body
    def html = new StringBuilder()
    html.append("<html><body>")
    html.append("<p><strong>Hello Team,</strong></p>")
    html.append("<p><strong>Kindly find Interface Execution Summary below :</strong></p>")
   
  //summary table start‚ÄÇ
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("<table border='1' cellpadding='5' cellspacing='0'>")
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("<tr><td><b>Flow Name: </b></td><td> ${Iflow_Name}</td></tr>")
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("<tr><td><b>Flow Execution CustomLogMessage :</b></td><td> ${FlowExecutionStatusMsg}</td></tr>")
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("<tr><td><b>MPL ID :</b></td><td> ${MPL_id}</td></tr>")
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("<tr><td><b>Timestamp:</b></td><td> ${currentTimestamp}</td></tr>")
    html.append("<tr><td><b>Refer to Attachment in SAP IS Monitoring : FileName - </b></td><td> ${label}</td></tr>")
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("<tr><td><b>Exception Details : </b></td><td> ${exceptionDetails} </td></tr>")
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("<tr><td><b>Message Payload Body At Runtime Step: </b></td><td> ${body} </td></tr>")
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("</table><br>")
//summary table end

//start of properties table
    html.append("<h4>Exchange Properties</h4>")
    html.append("<table border='1' cellpadding='5' cellspacing='0'>")
    html.append("<tr><th>Property Name</th><th>Value</th></tr>")
    sortedProperties.each
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ{ k, v ->
        html.append("<tr><td>${k}</td><td>${v}</td></tr>")
    }
    html.append("</table><br>")
//end of properties table

//headers start table
    html.append("<h4>Message Headers</h4>")
    html.append("<table border='1' cellpadding='5' cellspacing='0'>")
    html.append("<tr><th>Header Name</th><th>Value</th></tr>")
    sortedHeaders.each
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ{ k, v ->
        html.append("<tr><td>${k}</td><td>${v}</td></tr>")
    }
    html.append("</table><br>")
//headers end table
   
    html.append("<p>Kindly Do Not Reply to this auto-generated mail.Please contact SAP-Integration Support Team for further investigation.</p>")
    html.append("<p>Regards,<br> SAP CPI Admin</p>")    

    html.append("</body></html>")

    // Note - Set Mail Adapter MIME type to "text/html"
    def logMessage = html.toString()
    message.setBody(logMessage)
   
    // Log Attachment + Custom Header Property
    if (messageLog != null)
    {
    messageLog.addAttachmentAsString(label, logMessage, "text/html")
    messageLog.addCustomHeaderProperty("FlowExecutionStatusMsg", FlowExecutionStatusMsg)
    }
    message.setProperty("MailLogBody", logMessage)
   
    return message
}

Below are steps/code snippets and configuration need to be done in the interface -

Add Custom text message (logically for your debugging/monitoring) as per the Interface flow. 

Add Iflow name which acts as identifier in complex mutliple flows development and will be displayed in mail too.

Mail configuration: I have used externalization for ease of code transport. 

Configure From, To, Subject with specific details.

Mail body has the value set by the groovy output, which would be visible in the outlook mail.

In Monitoring tab, Custom Header below will reflect the custom text message set in the content modifier.

The attachment Flow log with the timestamp is set by the groovy script and would be visible in Monitoring tab for later debugging. It would have the runtime execution details.

The Mail body would consist of below details - Summary table, Properties and Headers. (I have scrubbed data for usage) 

This can be altered in the groovy script as per one's use case requirement. 

Hope this assist you in smoother debugging. 

P.S - This is my first blog despite spending a decade in Integration space, hope to invest time and effort consciously in blogging henceforth after project implementations going forth. Thanks.

entry.title: Re: Default Output GST Tax Code by Warehouse Code in Sale...
entry.content:
Hi,

Use below FMS query

SELECT DISTINCT 'ZR' FROM RDR1 T0 WHERE $[$38.24.11] = 'HQ'

Note: Change tax code ZR to your code and ware house code HQ to your warehouse.

Thank you,

Nagarajan

entry.title: Re: Handling units with MTO: Sales order to be filled aut...
entry.content:
Hi Felix14,

handling units (HU) in repetitive manufacturing or discrete/process manufacturing does not have direct reference to a sales order. See also reply from Lakshmipathi.

If you create a planned HU in transaction MFP1, then sales order reference is not supported.

But if you create a realized HU in transaction MFP2/MFP22, then you get the sales order reference under certain circumstances.
Refer to SAP note https://me.sap.com/notes/2524903 "MFP22: Posting the HUs to the sales order stock"
Once you created a HU in transaction MFP22, then there is a flag/check box "sales order stock". If this check box is set and you press the button "Confirm HU (online)", then you navigate to transaction MFHU and here the sales order is filled. See attached screenshot.

The transaction MFHU is a multifunctional transaction, so all fields are available, even if they aren't needed for some actions.

I hope that this reply is helpful for you.

Best regards,
Barƒ±≈ü

entry.title: Re: PR document

entry.title: The Next Phase in the Deprecation of the Classic Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
As mentioned in the External Blog Post Important Notice: Changes in SAP Analytics Cloud Classic Stories & Analytic Applications, SAP Analytics Cloud has been in a phased approached to transition customers to the Optimized Experience.

With the 2025 Q3 QRC, SAP Analytics Cloud is entering its next phase. It reinforces our commitment to delivering a modern, high-performance, and consistent user experience within Business Data Cloud (BDC).

What‚Äôs Changing?

With this phase, customers will no longer be able to create new Classic Stories or Analytic Applications. For example, clicking on a new Canvas or Responsive Page in the Stories Module will now automatically launch the Optimized Story Experience instead of prompting the Designer in choosing between Optimized Story Experience and Classic Story Experience. It ensures that all new content benefits from the performance, usability, and functional improvements available.

  • üîí Creation of New Classic Stories and Applications is now DISABLED
  • ‚úÖ Existing Classic Assets (Stories and Analytic Application) remain EDITABLE and FULLY MAINTAINABLE

Continued Access to Existing Classic Assets

Even though new content creation in classic is disabled, existing Classic Stories and Analytic Applications can still be maintained. Our definition of maintainable includes:

  • View, Edit, and Save Content
  • Share, Duplicate, and Delete

‚ö†Ô∏è Continued access to Classic Assets remains until the full deprecation in the 2026 Q2 QRC where these assets will no longer be accessible. It means that customers should begin the migration to the Optimized Experience prior to this date.

Enhancements to File Repository and Object Management

With this phase, we‚Äôve made several usability improvements in how assets are presented and managed:

  • Visual Distinction: The File Repository now provides a clear visual distinction between Classic and Optimized Stories as well as Analytical Applications
  • (Deprecated) Labeling: Deprecated object types now include a ‚Äú(Deprecated)‚Äù suffix in their type
  • Granular Filtering: Object Type Filtering now has more granularity to filter between Classic Stories (Deprecated), Analytical Applications (Deprecated), and Stories

 

Streamlining the User Interface

We‚Äôve taken additional steps to simplify the user experience by removing entry points that led to these deprecated assets. For example:

  • Analytic Applications module no longer has a create button. It still displays the most recent Analytic Applications.
  • Stories module no longer has Smart Discovery or Grid Pages as selectable tiles
  • Clicking Canvas, Responsive, or Template now opens the Optimized Story instead of prompting the Designer in choosing between Optimized Story Experience and Classic Story Experience
  • Modeller module no longer has a Point of Interest Tab to create new Point of Interests
  • Actions from a Model to Create a new Canvas or Responsive opens the Optimized Story

 

Increasing Awareness for the Designer

Within the Classic Experience (Stories and Analytic Applications), we‚Äôve increased the severity of our Deprecation Warning to a Deprecation Notice. It appears in a more prominent indicator reminding the Designer that the Classic Asset will be disabled starting mid-2026. This warning is only shown to Story Designers, the users best positioned to initiate migration.

 

Preparing for Full Deprecation in 2026

This phase marks a significant milestone in our journey toward unifying and modernizing the SAP Analytics Cloud experience. We encourage all customers to begin or continue transitioning their Classic Stories and Analytic Applications to the Optimized Experience before the 2026 Q2 QRC to avoid any disruption. There are a few resources that we recommend.

Mass Migration Tool

With the 2024 Q4 QRC, we had released a Mass Migration Tool for Designers to migrate up to 50 assets to the Optimized Experience. There are a few steps that are involved which includes:                                              

  1. Selection of Assets
  2. Conversion Check & Status
  3. Conversion Settings
  4. Conversion Summary

You can learn more in the External Blog Post, Bulk Migration Tool to Convert Classic Assets to the Optimized Experience

Mass Deletion Tool for System Admins

With the 2025 Q2 QRC, within the System Overview ‚Äì Housekeeping, we had introduced an option for System Administers to delete specific objects, without the need of manual deletion object by object. There is a Last Access Date which helps System Administrators understand which objects are not actively used. 

But it doesn‚Äôt stop there. In addition to the primary object, all dependent objects are also automatically deleted. It means you no longer need to worry about unnecessary and unused objects adding up in your system and slowing down its performance.

You can learn more in the External Blog Post, Efficient Data Maintenance in SAP Analytics Cloud System Overview - Housekeeping

‚ö†Ô∏è For Stories we do not support the distinction between Classic and Optimized Experience. It will be made available in a future release.

Resources

  • Important Notice: Changes in SAP Analytics Cloud Classic Stories & Analytic Applications
  • Bulk Migration Tool to Convert Classic Assets to Optimized Experience
  • The New Table Building Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud (includes Blended Table)
  • Optimized Experience Restrictions & Discontinued Features
  • Mass Deletion Tool for System Administrators

entry.title: Re: Prevent empty version columns in table for version‚Äêre...
entry.content:
@Eliram_Lugassi 

If you have both the restricted measures and the version in the Table axis, this behavior is as expected. It will create a cartesian combination of both restricted measures with all versions. Ideally if you are restricting the measure with a version , you should not be having version dimension also in the axis. Just enable the constant selection feature in the restricted measure. Once you have the version restricted as constant selection you can get rid of the version dimension. If you need to keep both then you need to do some Advance Filtering.

 

Nikhil

entry.title: Growth Rebate in Condition Condition
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We wants to reward our customers that grow their purchase value by more than 15% YoY. Rebates are only applicable if current-year sales exceed base year by a defined percentage.

 For e.g -   Base year: 2024 - Target year: 2025 - Incentive: 5% rebate on incremental sales exceeding 15% growth

Does this scenario us possible in standard CCM S/4 HANA 2023 ? if yes How? 

Thank You

entry.title: Re: need information - modify database SAP
entry.content:
Hi,

Insert/update/delete statements are not allowed to change any SAP B1 tables. If any issue of this action, SAP will reject and not provide any solution.

Refer this previous thread,

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/i-need-to-create-select-insert-and-delete-method-for-exsisting-table/qaq-p/505902

Thank you,

Nagarajan

entry.title: Re: INVOICED PRUCHASE ORDERS
entry.content:
In ME2L itself, you have the option to filter based on Selection Parameter which should be WEIN, so that this will display POs with both GR and invoice postings. Once the report displays check the below two columns and you can conclude that

  • Still to be Invoiced Quantity/Value: If zero, the PO is fully invoiced.
  • Invoice Document Number: If populated, the PO has been invoiced.

entry.title: Re: PO price Change-Approval process
entry.content:
Hi,

Try this,

SELECT DISTINCT 'True'
FROM OPOR T0
INNER JOIN POR1 T1 ON T0."DocEntry" = T1."DocEntry"
INNER JOIN OCRD T2 ON T0."CardCode" = T2."CardCode"
INNER JOIN ITM1 T3 ON T1."ItemCode" = T3."ItemCode"
AND T3."PriceList" = T2."ListNum"
WHERE $[$38.14.NUMBER] <> T3."Price"

Thank you,

Nagarajan

entry.title: Re: Where to control when the accrual calendar runs? Accr...
entry.content:
Hi @laurasanchezf 

For accrual automation, "Accrual Creation Offset [Days]" is used execute the accrual automation without any manual action.

In the required time account, if you are setting "Level Of Accrual Automation" drop down as "Automatic Accrual Creation" then you have to maintain value in "Accrual Creation Offset [Days]". 

Example 

1. if you need to auto-accrue the time account for every future years on 01st Jan then you need to maintain the "Accrual Creation Offset [Days]" value as "1"

2. For 2026, if you need to auto-accrue the time account in 01st June 2025 then you need to maintain the "Accrual Creation Offset [Days]" value as "-183". 

Above requirement can be configured based on the business requirement. 

To configure the accrual posting date, you have to customise the "Accrual Rule" mapped in the time account type. 

Considering your example:- "Accrual to happen six months after the validity of my annual account"  - for this requirement, you have work only on the posting date. Refer the below screenshot.

Recommend to try the use cases/scenario in test environment. If it is working as per the expectation then deploy it in production.

Thanks

Arun

entry.title: Re: query Delivery return - read current doc no.
entry.content:
Hi,

Try this query,

SELECT T1.[DocEntry], T0.[DocNum], T0.[CardName], T0.[DocDate], T1.[ItemCode], T1.[Dscription], T1.[Quantity], T2.[U_NAME] FROM ORDN T0 INNER JOIN RDN1 T1 ON T0.[DocEntry] = T1.[DocEntry] INNER JOIN OUSR T2 ON T0.[UserSign] = T2.[USERID]

Thank you,

Nagarajan

entry.title: How to properly connect SAC to PaPM On-Prem with the PaPM API and use SSO
entry.content:
Dear experts:

I have a requirement to connect SAC to an On Premise PaPM instance using the PaPM API and it must use SSO as part of the connection. 

Suffice it to say, Paul Simon knows 50 ways to leave your lover, and I have found 50 so-called solutions to my problem, but none of them work. 

Has anyone been able to do what my requirement is asking for? Again, the PaPM instance is on premise and the user wants to use multiple functions in SAC for PaPM. We can get it to work with a static user and password, but even with all the setup work completed as per several blogs, the connection will not work.
